questions.question_text:
Your company hires a new employee in Lisbon.
You assign a Microsoft 365 E3 license to the employee.
The employee must schedule meetings that will include customers in Lisbon. The customers will dial in to the meetings by using PSTN.
You need to ensure that the employee can send meeting invitations that include a dial-in conferencing bridge. The bridge must be set to a local number in Lisbon instead of the company's default dial-in conferencing bridge number.
Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: Correct Option is Option A and C

comments.content: Oops I can't retract my upvote :(

discussion.content: A and C is correct answer. Confirmed in lab

C+D. "Your company hires a new employee". From MS Docs "For a new user, the default conferencing toll numbers is assigned based on the Usage Location set in the Microsoft 365 administration center of the user when the user is enabled for the Audio Conferencing service."

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/set-the-phone-numbers-included-on-invites-in-teams#new-users

BC is correct. I just tested on a demo tenant. You can not update the conference number on a user until its added to the tenant conference bridge. You also do not need to, when an invitation is sent the user has the option to find a local number, the one I added to the conference bridge was listed.

Selected Answer: AC
A and C - correct. Auto = audio.

instead of default conf number

The answer is not B because that would apply to the entire organization and not specifically this user
The answer is not D because a location change isn't required to change the toll number. See my answer for A

The question asks for a local Lisbon number. Setting the user's location to Portugal may not provide a local Lisbon number. Unless all numbers in the whole country are local. So I think D is not correct.

Pretty sure this would be A and C. Why? Because you only need a single employee to change thier dial in conference number default. So that is A. Also, C is correct because they mention this is a new hire. Most likely, they have not been assigned an audio conferencing license yet.

Selected Answer: CD
Bridge numbers are displayed in an invite based on the user's usage location.

Both answers are correct, but reading the question carefully saying they want to use a non default number, as per microsoft: 
"For a new user, the default conferencing toll numbers is assigned based on the Usage Location"

As we don't want the default number assigned, then it has to be manulaay changed from TAC not based on the usage location from M365.

The correct Answer is A,C
So how long before the wrong answers are corrected or are these the answers directly from Microsoft ?

It's C & D. The M365 / AAD License Usage Location controls the Dial Plan and the Conferencing Bridge Number. If you manually want to change the default dial in number, you have to edit it in TAC on the user itsself. I tested this in lab, my default conferencing bridge is UK and I changed an audio conferencing user to Usage Location Portugal. I can see that the number changed on his Teams User in TAC.

comments.content: C&D is correct. The key bit of info here is that there is already a public conferencing bridge number for Teams available in Lisbon. Because of that Teams will automatically use the user's usage location to set the default bridge line to it (as stated here: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/set-the-phone-numbers-included-on-invites-in-teams). If there were no conferencing bridge available in that usage location, Teams would use the default conferencing bridge for the tenant. Or the admin would have to provision a service number for that location specifically for their tenant (a step not offered in the potential answers) and manually assign it to the user in TAC or via PS. While A&C offer a partial potential solution, it's neither complete nor easiest. C&D is the best answer.

discussion.content: Agreed Satish it is A and C. So refreshing that once can comment.
How is this not C and D? The usage location assigns the audio conferencing number to your meetings

comments.content: OK, I see this is PSTN. whoops

discussion.content: This question is shady, the answer is suggesting we change the default conferencing bridge, except reading the question it suggests that only this one person needs to send a Lisbon bridge number as their default, so the correct answer is questionable....

choices.A: From Users in the Microsoft Teams admin center, edit the Audio conferencing settings of the employee.
choices.D: From the Microsoft 365 admin center, set the usage location of the employee to Portugal.
choices.C: From the Microsoft 365 admin center, assign an Auto Conferencing add-on license to the employee.
choices.B: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, modify the settings of the default conferencing bridge.

Both answers are +13305551212.

The regular expression ? means "Match 0 or 1 of the perceding set or character"
the expression is ^8? --> means with 8 or without 8. so it will be +1330555xxx OR +13308555xxx.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment.
You have a dial plan that contains the following normalization rule:
✑ Pattern: ^8?(\d{7})$

Translation: +1330$1 -
//IMG//

How will the phone numbers be normalized? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

comments.content: you absolutely right. The question is wrong

discussion.content:
Can someone explain this example for me?

For example, an E.164 number of +61370105550 will be translated to 03 7010 5550 and +61255505550 will be translated to 02 5550 5550.
The suggested answer is ^\+61(\d{9})$ to strip +61 from the full number and keep 9 digits.

With the $1 translation to me this means +61370105550 will be translated to: 3 7010 5550
Or am I wrong here?

To me the question is wrong, or has something missing, should the translation rule not be 0$1 to make it 03 7010 5550?

https://blog.insycle.com/phone-number-formatting-crm - "In many countries including the UK, a “0” is placed at the beginning of the area code and subscriber number. With E.164, the “0” is typically removed, with a “+” and the international country code added before the area code."
answer with ^\61(\d{10})$
Yes, the translation is wrong

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You need to ensure that numbers dialed from the Melbourne warehouse conform to the dialing rules of the phone carrier.
How should you complete the command? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//
questions.answer_description:
Box 1: New-CsTeamsTranslationRule
The New-CsTeamsTranslationRule cmdlet to create a new telephone number manipulation rule.
Example:
New-CsTeamsTranslationRule -Identity 'AddPlus1' -Pattern '^(\d{10})$' -Translation '+1$1'
This example creates a rule that strips +1 from any E.164 eleven digits number. For example, +12065555555 will be translated to 206555555
Example 2:
New-CsTeamsTranslationRule -Identity 'StripE164SeattleAreaCode' -Pattern '^\+1206555(\d{4})$' -Translation '$1'
This example creates a rule that strips +1206555 from any E.164 ten digits number. For example, +12065555555 will be translated to 5555
Box 2: '^\+61(\d{9})$'
Strip out +61. Keep 9 digits.
Note: You are opening a new warehouse site in Melbourne. The new warehouse will connect to a phone carrier by using a Session Border Controller (SBC).
Dialing rules are an area code of two digits beginning with a zero followed by a subscriber number of eight digits. For example, an E.164 number of
+61370105550 will be translated to 03 7010 5550 and +61255505550 will be translated to 02 5550 5550.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/skype/new-csteamstranslationrule

choices.F: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, modify the dial-out settings of the users.
choices.B: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, order five user numbers.
choices.G: From the Microsoft 365 admin center, create a support ticket to request five phone numbers.
choices.A: From the Microsoft 365 admin center, modify the office phone numbers of the users.
choices.D: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, assign the phone numbers to the users.
choices.C: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, assign a calling policy to the users.
choices.E: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, assign a voice routing policy to the users.

Which three actions should you include in the recommendation? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
